alert.note: Alert for Hemphill; Roberts; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wheeler, northeastern Roberts and Hemphill Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Briscoe, or 21 miles north of Shamrock, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Canadian, Briscoe, Wheeler, New Mobeetie, Allison, Glazier, Lake Marvin, Kellerville and Mobeetie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
